```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```



# Problem 1

Firstly, we create a data frame include 4 different type variables.

```{r}
problem1_df = 
  tibble(
    norm_samp = rnorm(10),
    ele_great_0 = norm_samp > 0,
    vec_char = c("Rhinos", "Kittens", "Raccoons", "Goats", "Skunks", "Hedgehogs", "Otters", "Giraffes", "Seals", "Fox"),
    vec_factor = factor(c("herbivore", "carnivores", "omnivorous",  "herbivore", "omnivorous", "omnivorous", "carnivores", "herbivore", "carnivores", "omnivorous"))
    )

problem1_df
```

Secondly, we take the mean of each variable in the dataframe.

```{r}
mean(pull(problem1_df, norm_samp))
mean(pull(problem1_df, ele_great_0))
mean(pull(problem1_df, vec_char))
mean(pull(problem1_df, vec_factor))
```
